article.paragraph: Kim Renard Nazel(born June 17, 1965cite webhttp://westcoastpioneers.com/artists/arabian-prince.htmlArabian Prince | West Coast Rap Artists | West Coast Rap Pioneers | Tribute to the Early West Coast Rap Scene: Website TitleWestcoastpioneers.com1965-06-172015-08-15), better known by hisstage nameArabian Prince, is an Americanrappingrapperandhip hop productionhip hop producer, best known for being an original member of the rap groupN.W.A.cite webhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vArabian Prince: Eazy-E's Wife Stopped Sending My Royalty ChecksYouTube2015-09-232015-09-29cite webhttp://hiphopdx.com/interviews/id.1197/title.arabian-prince-new-funky-nationArabian Prince: New Funky NationHipHopDX23 August 2008HipHopDX23 August 2015cite webhttp://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/music/arabian-prince-what-happened-after-nwa-and-the-posse-6588582Arabian Prince: What Happened After N.W.A. and the Posse?Martin CizmarPhoenix New Times23 August 2015cite webhttp://www.scpr.org/blogs/offramp/2012/07/16/7044/lost-nwa-member-arabian-prince-plays-macarthur-par/Lost N.W.A member Arabian Prince plays MacArthur Park on July 28Southern California Public RadioSouthern California Public Radio23 August 2015cite webhttp://uk.askmen.com/daily/austin_150/182d_fashion_style.htmlN.W.A. - AskMenKyle GraceAskMen23 August 2015
article.heading: Biography
article.paragraph: Arabian Prince started working withBobby Jimmy & the Crittersin 1984. He also produced the hit single and album forJJ Fad, "Supersonic."

He was a founding member ofN.W.Abut when fellow memberIce Cubecame back from the Phoenix Institute of Technology in 1988, Arabian Prince found himself to be surplus to the bandEazy-E, Ice Cube andMC Renwere the main performers,DJ Yellawas theturntablistandDr. Drewas the main producer.cite webhttp://www.laweekly.com/music/whatever-happened-to-nwas-posse-2164896Whatever Happened to N.W.A's Posse?Martin CizmarL.A. Weekly23 August 2015

After leaving N.W.A, Arabian Prince began his solo career.His first solo albumBrother Arabwas released in 1989, although it sold poorly. He continued his solo career and released his fourth albumWhere's My Bytchesin 1993, which was his last album of the 1990s.

In the mid-2000's, he started releasing music again, with his Professor X project on the Dutch label Clone records. In 2007, he performed as a DJ on the 2K Sports Holiday Bounce Tour with artists from theStones Throwlabel. In 2008, Stones Throw released a compilation of his electro-rap material from the 1980s.cite webhttp://stonesthrow.com/arabianprince/Arabian Prince | Stones Throw RecordsStonesthrow.com2015-08-15One of his songs was included on the 2007 video game,College Hoops 2K8.
